data.title: One account for all apps
points: One user account that will let the users connect to all applications on your organization
Supports single sign on (SSO), so that user don't have to re-enter sign-in information on every application
When a user signs out from one application, session is invalidated for all other applications.

data.title: Sign in using social identity
points: Supported external identity providers - Outlook, Google, Facebook
Choose which external identity providers you would like your company members to use
You can limit the sign in only to native oneauth method

data.title: Customizable Sign in page
points: Customize with your brand logo and background
Choose from two layouts for sign-in page
Extend further and write your own sign-in page frontend. Our REST API allows you to seemlessly integrate, your custom front page with Oneauth's secure backend

data.title: Distribute apps as restricted or free
points: As an application creator, you can choose to publish the app as free or restricted
When you mark as application as free, it is accessible to all companies having thier space in Oneauth
Restricted applications need to grant explicit permissions to a company space (for use by that company)
You can publish a paid/cloud subscription application and selectively grant access to companies that paid for the subscription

data.title: Two factor authentication (2FA) - Coming soon
points: Increase your security level significantly using two factor authentication
Supports OTP over mobile SMS. Less secure compared to time based codes
Supports time based security codes using Google authenticator or Authy
